23.title: Insecure Telnet Service
23.description: Port 23 allows unencrypted remote control. Hackers can easily intercept commands and passwords.
23.mitigation: Disable remote administration in settings or block port 23 on your router.

21.title: FTP File Transfer
21.description: Port 21 is used for file transfers but is often unencrypted. Data can be intercepted.
21.mitigation: Ensure you are using SFTP instead, or disable this service if not needed.

554.title: RTSP Video Stream
554.description: Port 554 is used for streaming video. If not password protected, anyone can watch the feed.
554.mitigation: Set a strong password for the video stream in the device settings.

80.title: HTTP Web Interface
80.description: Standard web interface. Ensure it is password protected.
80.mitigation: No immediate action, but ensure the admin panel has a strong password.

true.title: Default Password In Use
true.description: This device is using a factory default password (e.g., 'admin'/'admin'). This is the #1 way devices are hacked.
true.mitigation: Change the password IMMEDIATELY in the device settings.

none.title: No Encryption
none.description: Data sent by this device is not encrypted. Attackers on the network can see everything.
none.mitigation: Check for firmware updates that enable encryption (SSL/TLS) or stop using this device for sensitive tasks.

WEP.title: Obsolete WEP Encryption
WEP.description: WEP is an outdated security standard that can be cracked in minutes.
WEP.mitigation: Reconfigure the device to use WPA2 or WPA3.

obsolete.title: Outdated Firmware
obsolete.description: The device software is old and may contain known security holes.
obsolete.mitigation: Go to the manufacturer's website or app and update the firmware.
